subject: Re: New: Gainesville House EVPs!
author: Lance Oliver
full_text:
Hi Ann,

I guess a bit of explaining is called for. First off, the EVPs I 
uploaded to Filecrunch are there and in good working order. That site 
offers free uploads and downloads sometime too big for Yahoo, but 
there is a trick to using it.

After you click on the link to my page there, click on a file name 
you wish to download. The following page has a 10 second delay before 
they'll allow you to download. Just scroll down the page, and when 
you see the Download Now, click and away you go...

Thanks for reminding me to clarify that!

Lance


--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Lisby <lisby@...> wrote:
>
> I'd really like to listen to these, but when I try to open them, I  
> get nothing at all. Can you upload them to our files or just 
attach  
> them to e-mail or both?
> 
> 
> On Dec 6, 2007, at 12:45 AM, Lance Oliver wrote:
> 
> > Good Evening!
> >
> > I've been very busy today going through a long, intense audio
> > recording taken at the Gainesville, Texas house, which my team
> > investigated on Sunday, November 25th.
> >
> > All of the EVPs I just posted were gathered in the unoccupied
> > upstairs bedroom. Only three investigators were present in the 
room.
> > Their voices have been properly taken into account and ruled out 
as
> > sources of the actual EVPs.
> >
> > The new and resampled EVPs have been saved as .mp3 files. They 
can be
> > freely downloaded from the site here -
> >
> > http://www.filecrunch.com/user/orbhunterx
> >
> > You will hear quite a few odd words, dog barks, and even mimicry.
> > Some of the voices are faint and whispery. Other EVP voices sound
> > like the invisibles are standing right along side the researchers!
> >
> > Sexual Content Warning:
> >
> > Several of the EVPs have strong sexual content.
> >
> > Please read the file name prior to downloading.
> >
> > Listening to the EVPs will be at your own disgression.
> >
> > That stated, those that choose to listen to the EVPs, please let 
me
> > know if any of them need further contextual clarification. I look
> > forward to hearing feedback. As it stands, the true nature of 
what's
> > going on in the house awaits much more serious attention.
> >
> > Sincerely,
> > Lance Oliver, Founder
> > Denton Area Paranormal Society
> >
> >
> >
>
